newsitem.title: INDIA: India to release 2.05 mln T sugar for free sale.
newsitem.headline: India to release 2.05 mln T sugar for free sale.

text.p: India will release 2.05 million tonnes of sugar for free sale during the first quarter of 1997, compared to 1.9 million tonnes in the corresponding period last year, the United News of India (UNI) said on Tuesday.

The federal government has decided to release 650,000 tonnes of indigenous freesale sugar quotas in January next year, and 700,000 tonnes each in February and March, UNI quoted an official statement as saying.

"With 369,000 tonnes of levy sugar quota released for each of these months, the total quantity of sugar available for internal consumption would be 1.019 million tonnes for January, and 1.069 million tonnes each for February and March," the statement said.
The statement by India's Food Ministry said the government had also decided to extend the freesale quota for December 1996 upto January 10, 1997.
